column1: The '''Moors of the Nibin-noeg''' were high uplands that rose between the [[Vales of Sirion]] and the [[Narog]]
column3: note 16</ref>  On the eastern side rose prominence of [[Amon Rûdh]].  The moor was covered in thickets of ''[[aeglos (plant)|aeglos]]''.<ref>{{CH|7}}

column1: The moorlands were associated with the [[Nibin-noeg]] because in ancient times they had been part of their lands. Nargothrond to the west had originally been delved by the Nibin-noeg
column3: p. 121</ref> as had the chambers at the top of Amon Rûdh
column4: known by the Petty-dwarves as ''[[Sharbhund]]'' before the coming of the Elves.<ref>{{CH|7}}

column1: In the [[The Second 'Silmarillion' Map|Second 'Silmarillion' Map]] the Moors were named '''Moors of the Neweglu'''.<ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}
column3: 187 (note 26).</ref> The name ''[[Neweglu]]'' does not appear elsewhere
column4: but it is close to the name ''Neweg
column6: one of the names of the Petty-dwarves found in the ''Narn'' papers.<ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}
